experience: You and Sonny both know Steven Roberts, Fred von Graf, PMP, and 15 others

I am excited to report that I have joined Skintifika, LLC as Chief Operating Officer.  The company was founded by a husband and wife team of medical professionals, with the goal of providing high grade skin care products and treatments that are not only effective, but cost effective as well.  All-natural ingredients are sourced globally and compounded in FDA-certified labs, with multiple quality checkpoints along the way.      I am chartered with essentially building a company around these products and their associated services.  I am responsible for marketing, sales, fulfillment, customer service, and essentially all operations.     I am especially excited to work with this team, as they are wonderful people and we have become fast friends.  I've been looking for something just like this for over 2 years now and I am blessed to have met this couple at just the right time in my life.  Stay tuned for more as we build out the messaging and the company.  I am thrilled to be in this position!web: www.skintifika.comFaceBook: www.facebook.com/skintifikatwitter: @skintifikaLinkedIn: https://www.linkedin.com/company/skintifika-llc
During my very welcome sabbatical, I've been:Co-authoring a book on spiritualityProviding pro-bono consulting to small businessesVolunteeringGenerally enjoying life!

Led, motivated and developed a team of over 250 consultants nationally through six direct reports.Led field Operations and eventually transitioned Operations into a Corporate function.Managed a payroll of over $30M annually and maintained high utilization of the consulting team while still providing for Professional Development opportunities.Cultivated and maintained a thriving field culture and employee morale through creation of lunch & learn programs, recognition events, and community involvement.Leveraged strong skills in Data Analytics using Tableau Desktop and a passion for data-driven business to develop a number of new metrics for the business, which enabled the detection and identification of several sources of waste and other high value results.  Developed programs that reduced or eliminated waste across several categories.Reconstructed the consultant incentive plan, increasing employee satisfaction and creating incremental revenue and increased profitability.Created College Hire Boot Camp training program to bring new college graduates into the organization and shape them into Associate Consultants.Developed field office real estate standards and branding plan.  Planned, designed, and delivered the first new field office under the new standards in Seattle, WA in Feb 2015 to great acclaim.
Vice President, Service Delivery Group Operations

Led Service Delivery and was accountable for services revenue, customer satisfaction, and profitability for the entire company — including over 200 services professionals and leaders — and grew revenue to approximately $80M.Drove turn-around of under-performing offices through increased focus and applying corporate resources and attention.Executed on market re-alignment in support of company goals and sub-market performance, reducing costs and increasing profitability.Supported and was instrumental in the company’s re-organization into People, Client, and Talent functions and nationalizing the delivery model to allow for greater scale and growth.

Grew a team from 13 to over 40 consultants of varying specialties and led them to deliver transformational business solutions to customers in the Desert Southwest.  Accountable to P&L for what became the largest region in the company.Facing some of the most difficult economic conditions imaginable, achieved the following outstanding results in this role:>50% CAGR for top-line revenue79% CAGR for net profit - more than tripling profits in year oneMore than doubled active client baseIncreased revenue/client, average deal size, and reduced transaction overheadMore than tripled the number of billable consultantsIncreased employee satisfaction and reduced unwanted attritionRecruited, coached, mentored, and motivated an outstanding team, arguably the most talented in the company.  This was one of the most rewarding parts of this role.

Directed a team of up to 26 IT professionals, including contractors, full-time employees, and another Director to deliver solutions in the web and eCommerce disciplines.  Managed to an operational budget of over $3M, supporting diverse technologies, such as Classic ASP, HTML, Vignette 6 and Vignette 7 Content Management Systems (CMS), Vignette Application Portal, Google Search Appliance, Sharepoint 2003, ASP.NET 1.1 & 2.0, J2EE on Websphere Application Server, Websphere Commerce Suite, and Endeca search engine.Led the eCommerce and Web development teams to design and complete the integration of the Endeca search engine into the Electronics Marketing business unit’s eCommerce website.Led the team and the process to select a vendor for an enterprise search engine - a critical foundational element of the Electronics Marketing business unit’s eCommerce website.Directed the successful migration of a complex, 3 leg, n-tier Vignette 6 CMS environment from aging hardware to a robust VMWare environment, reducing support costs, reducing risk, and reducing unplanned downtime to nearly zero.Led the IT team to migrate key components of the Electronics Marketing business unit’s Intranet from legacy technology to a Sharepoint platform, increasing utilization of the information and enabling self-managed content.

Recognizing the coming pervasiveness of the Web and the recognition that first-mover advantage in our particular niche would be critical, the company selected me to head up an eBusiness initiative, including the management of some strategic partnerships, working with one of our allied brands.Key accomplishments:Pioneered the first parametrically searchable online catalog for semiconductor devices with normalized data, allowing direct comparisons across multiple manufacturers for non-commodity products.Developed and deployed the company's first consolidated, multi-brand, multi-national, and multi-lingual website and accompanying content management system.Developed and deployed a single global intranet system, encompassing 38 entities across the globe, and allowing multi-departmental, geographic, and brand-specific taxonomies for publishing and consuming content.  The site was fully internationalized - permitting making any content item available in multiple languages, anywhere across the globe.  This became especially critical for communications related to our eventual acquisition by Avnet.

A Memec CompanyWith the consolidation of some leadership positions within the company, I was selected to take over general management of our West Florida business, ultimately achieving nearly $40 Million in annual sales using only 7 staff.  Met or exceeded company profitability goals, despite a lower margin business mix.  My team included Field Application Engineers, Inside Sales Representatives, Area Account Managers, and a Strategic Account Manager.

A Memec CompanyContinued expansion of our business in West Florida necessitated continued expansion of our Sales force, further necessitating the addition of leadership for our Sales team.  This was my first true direct management role, which I relished and was a role in which I thrived.

A Memec CompanyRecognizing my ability to develop partnerships with large strategic clients, which was challenging for a distribution firm in the mid-90s, Insight promoted me to this position focusing on a small number of very large clients, primarily in Contract Electronics Manufacturing services, across Western Florida.
University of Hard Work and Applied Intelligence
My decades of broad experience add up to more than any 4 or 6 year degree program could possibly offer.
Registered Emergency Medical Technician; Certified Emergency Vehicle Operator

Serving Southern and Central Brevard County, Florida, HCVAS was a volunteer organization providing Basic and Advanced Life Support ambulance services for 33 continuous years under contract to Brevard County.  It's membership ranks swelled to over 1,000 members during my years of service, and we operated 13 stations 24x7x365 at the time.  I personally accumulated over 2,000 hours of volunteer time in the two years I was active, which pales in comparison to some of the members who were there from the start, accumulating over 30,000 hours.This was an extremely rewarding educational experience for me and a great way to serve my community at the time.  Being regularly involved in life or death situations is a real adrenaline rush, but it also teaches a respect and appreciation for the fragility of human life, and true empathy for those who experience loss.  Being involved in a mass casualty incident gave me experience in maintaining calm and focus in a crisis situation, directing my energy towards providing safety and relief for those who were in harm's way, while keeping my team and myself safe.

I had the great pleasure of working with Sonny both as his direct report in the organization he was leading as well as collaborated with him in my other roles outside his organization. Above all, Sonny is a great leader with great team building skills with sharp instincts for identifying and growing key strategic leaders in every role he has taken. I full heartedly recommend Sonny for key leadership roles where technology leadership with a modern data driven mind set is key to success.

June 3, 2016, Sonny managed Dale directly

I recall deciding in the first few minutes of our first interview that I wanted to hire Dale.  His calm demeanor and understated confidence instill calm and confidence in others - both his team members and his internal clients.  His broad skill base allows him to relate to and empathize with his team members better than most people in a similar role.  He is always willing to take on extra tasks and those that are outside the normal responsibilities of his role are especially notable.  I could always rely on Dale for honest, actionable feedback on projects and initiatives, and also applaud his ability to triage what I needed to know operationally vs. overwhelming me with every detail.  I would highly recommend Dale for any role he might seek and would gladly work with him again, given the opportunity.
